case_vignette: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department with pain in his right eye. The patient states that his eye hurts and that he cannot see well. He cannot remember when his symptoms started or what caused them. The patient has a past medical history of schizophrenia and IV drug abuse. His current medications include intramuscular haloperidol and nicotine patches. The patient has a 20 pack-year smoking history. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 120/68 mmHg, pulse is 100/min, respirations are 15/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. On physical exam, you note a poorly kempt man and the findings in Figure A. Pain is elicited upon examination of cranial nerve III in the right eye. The patient is unable to read a chart on the wall of the exam room and complains of double vision.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My right eye hurts, I can't see well, and I'm experiencing double vision.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I can't remember when my symptoms started or what caused them.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications?
Yes, I have schizophrenia and I've been taking intramuscular haloperidol and using nicotine patches.
Do you have a family history of any neurological conditions?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history, so I don't know.
I understand. Have you had any recent head trauma or injury?
I can't remember what caused my symptoms.
Understood. Are you male or female, and how old are you?
I'm a 27-year-old man.

**Final Diagnosis:** Acute onset of symptoms with visual disturbance and double vision, associated with use of haloperidol and presence of schizophrenia, suggests a possible diagnosis of haloperidol-induced oculogyric crisis. However, further evaluation is needed.
